headline: CrowdStrike, Datadog and other cybersecurity stocks slide after Anthropic's AI tool launch
summary: Shares of cybersecurity companies including CrowdStrike and Datadog slumped on Monday, as investors ‌weighed the potential impact of artificial intelligence startup Anthropic's ‌new security tool on the industry.  Shares of CrowdStrike, Datadog and Zscaler fell around 11%, while those of Fortinet and Okta were down roughly ‌6%.  Palo Alto Networks ⁠dropped 3% and SentinelOne was down by 5%.

headline: Datadog (DDOG) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of cloud monitoring platform Datadog (NASDAQ:DDOG) fell 11.6% in the afternoon session after the White House announced plans to raise global tariffs to 15%.

summary: Datadog, Inc. (NASDAQ:DDOG) is one of the AI stocks that will go to the moon. headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Skids As EU Makes Trump Tariff Move; These Gold Stocks Shine (Live Coverage)
summary: Indexes, including the Dow Jones industrials, dived on the stock market today. The EU made a Trump tariff move. Novo stock slid but gold plays shined.

headline: Software Stocks Are Having Another Ugly Day
summary: The weeks-long selloff in software stocks deepened Monday amid general unease about the threat posed by AI. Software-makers AppLovin, CrowdStrike, Datadog, Workday, Expedia and Intuit were all among the S&P 500's worst 10 performers around midday, dropping at least 7%.
